subject: Adding Test Utility Code for Testing VPN
commitMessage:
Adding Test Utility Code for Testing VPN

The VPN API's test utility provides methods exposed by for VPN are as follows:

* create_slist => Create a VPN Connection using GSList
* create_hash_table => Create a VPN Connection using GHashTable
* remove => Remove a VPN Connection
* get_connections => Fetch all the VPN Connections currently configured
* register_vpn_agent => Register the Agent
* unregister_vpn_agent => Unregister the Agent
* set_connection_added_cb => Set Callback for the ConnectionAdded Signal
* unset_connection_added_cb => Unset Callback for the ConnectionAdded Signal
* set_connection_removed_cb => Set Callback for the ConnectionRemoved Signal
* unset_connection_removed_cb => Unset Callback for the ConnectionRemoved Signal

* get_properties => Get Properties of a Particular Connection
* set_property => Set A Property of Specific VPN Connection
* clear_property => Clear A Property of Specific VPN Connection
* connect => Connect a VPN Connection
* disconnect => Disconnect a VPN Connection

* set_property_changed_cb => Set Callback for the PropertyChanged Signal
* unset_property_changed_cb => Unset Callback for the PropertyChanged Signal

Change-Id: Ib5ad3f5ba6bd025f4e2ce256f9a51d1c2f8a281e

comments.message:
Patch Set 4:

Why did you create a new executable connman-vpn-test instead of adding a submenu in connman-lib-test for VPN tests (but keeping code in separate file connman-vpn-test.c) ?

Patch Set 4:

> Why did you create a new executable connman-vpn-test instead of
 > adding a submenu in connman-lib-test for VPN tests (but keeping
 > code in separate file connman-vpn-test.c) ?

Connman-VPN is a seperate Daemon. To test the functionality that interacts with this Daemon, Its better to have a separate connman-vpn-test utility. That is why I chose to have a separate connman-vpn-test executable.

Patch Set 5:

Sushil:
Since VPN feature is wrapped in ConnMan lib, it's better add the vpn test in ConnMan-lib test program as well, which can save some similar source codes and looks more consistent with other features.

Patch Set 6:

> Sushil:
 > Since VPN feature is wrapped in ConnMan lib, it's better add the
 > vpn test in ConnMan-lib test program as well, which can save some
 > similar source codes and looks more consistent with other features.

IMHO Merging the connman-vpn-test executable can be done at a later point when we have a stable VPN library. Currently other developers who work on connman-lib will not get affected OR confused unnecessarily with VPN feature now.

Patch Set 6:

Sushil: 
You know that adding vpn test into connman-lib test program will only affect the test program instead of connman-lib library, and the test program will only be launched manually when we try to test connman-lib.
Since vpn feature is wrapped in ConnMan lib, why we don't add vpn test codes into connman-lib test program?

subject: Added VPN Create and Remove API's
commitMessage:
Added VPN Create and Remove API's

The Patch contains the following major changes:
1. Create a VPN Profile from Settings (Hash & List)
2. VPN Agent Registration and De-Registration API's

Change-Id: Ida4f0a8abdb390779f94bf7e58a5db99b42e1c18

subject: [VPN] Basic Library Initialize and De-Initialize Code
commitMessage:
[VPN] Basic Library Initialize and De-Initialize Code

The following code changes are part of this patch:
  1. Basic Skeleton for the Library Code
  2. Connman VPN Manager Initialize & De-Initialize
  3. Registering the Signals from the Connman VPN Daemon
  4. Connman VPN Manager Callback Registration

Change-Id: I9948e758de8d3f74da274914e50a0a2fb0f8379b
